3.title: Simplr Router
3.headline: Why Simplr RouterQuick and simple
3.body: Simple to get up and running. Basic setup in just a few lines of code.

4.title: Simplr Router
4.headline: Small
4.body: No dependencies and a small codebase means less breaking parts. 0 dependencies means that what you see is what you get.

5.title: Simplr Router
5.headline: Easy to transition into
5.body: Works by utilizing the native API's used for navigation and therefore doesn't require any extra steps compared to your every day MPA.

6.title: Simplr Router
6.headline: Web Component focused
6.body: Built with web components, for web components. Simplr Router was designed from the get go to be used in web component applications.

7.title: Simplr Router
7.headline: Customizable
7.body: Even though there's no configuration necessary to get started, the router ships with a lot of customizability to fit your needs.

8.title: Simplr Router
8.headline: Performant
8.body: Allowing for lazy loading and creating dynamic routes, Simplr Router is a great library for projects of all sizes.

16.title: Getting started: Using a starter
16.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
16.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

17.title: Getting started: Using a starter
17.headline: Initial setup
17.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

18.title: Getting started: Using a starter
18.headline: Installing the router
18.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

19.title: Getting started: Using a starter
19.headline: Creating your initial routing
19.body:
Let's start by removing the main web component from our index.html  -file. 
< body >  
  < script  type = " module"   src = " ./src/simplr-router-demo.js"  >   </ script >  
</ body >  
  
Then we'll move on to modifying the file loaded by our index.html. In our case that file is named simplr-router-demo.js  
Let's first initialize the routing for our

120.title: Getting started: Using a starter
120.headline: Create a link to navigate to the page
120.body:
Lastly you'll need a way to navigate to the page. This is where Simplr Router differs from some other
routing libraries: You'll do it the same way you'd do it with a Multi Page Application: 
Add a anchor tag pointing to the new page into the starting view: 
// SimplrRouterDemo.js
// Some code omitted for clarity
render() {
    return html`
      <main>
        <div class="logo"><img alt="open-wc logo" src=${logo} /></div>
        <h1>${this.title}</h1>

        <p>Edit <code>src/SimplrRouterDemo.js</code> and save to reload.</p>
        <a
          class="app-link"
          href="https://open-wc.org/guides/developing-components/code-examples/"
          target="_blank"
          rel="noopener noreferrer"
        >
          Code examples
        </a>
      </main>

      <p class="app-footer">
        🚽 Made with love by
        <a
          target="_blank"
          rel="noopener noreferrer"
          href="https://github.com/open-wc"
          >open-wc</a
        >.
      </p>
    `;
}

c.title: Getting started: Using a starter
c.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
c.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

d.title: Getting started: Using a starter
d.headline: Initial setup
d.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

e.title: Getting started: Using a starter
e.headline: Installing the router
e.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

f.title: Getting started: Using a starter
f.headline: Creating your initial routing
f.body:
Let's start by removing the main web component from our index.html  -file. 
< body >  
  < script  type = " module"   src = " ./src/simplr-router-demo.js"  >   </ script >  
</ body >  
  
Let's start by modifying the file loaded by our index.html. In our case that file is named simplr-router-demo.js  
Let's first initialize the routing for our

4k.title: Getting started: Using a starter
4k.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
4k.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

4l.title: Getting started: Using a starter
4l.headline: Initial setup
4l.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

4m.title: Getting started: Using a starter
4m.headline: Installing the router
4m.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

5v.headline: Why Simplr RouterQuick and simple
5v.body: Simple to get up and running. Basic setup in just a few lines of code.

5w.title: Simplr Router
5w.headline: Small
5w.body: No dependencies and a small codebase means less breaking parts. 0 dependencies means that what you see is what you get.

5x.title: Simplr Router
5x.headline: Easy to transition into
5x.body: Works by utilizing the native API's used for navigation and therefore doesn't require any extra steps compared to your every day MPA.

5y.title: Simplr Router
5y.headline: Web Component focused
5y.body: Built with web components, for web components. Simplr Router was designed from the get go to be used in web component applications.

5z.title: Simplr Router
5z.headline: Customizable
5z.body: Even though there's no configuration necessary to get started, the router ships with a lot of customizability to fit your needs.

af.title: Getting started: Using a starter
af.headline: Initial setup
af.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

ah.title: Getting started: Using a starter
ah.headline: Running the application
ah.body:
npm  start
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

jb.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
jb.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

jc.title: Getting started: Using a starter
jc.headline: Initial setup
jc.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

jd.title: Getting started: Using a starter
jd.headline: Installing the router
jd.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

o4.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

o5.title: Getting started: Using a starter
o5.headline: Initial setup
o5.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

o6.title: Getting started: Using a starter
o6.headline: Installing the router
o6.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

o7.title: Getting started: Using a starter
o7.headline: Configuring History API fallback
o7.body:
To have client-side routing functioning correctly, we'll need to add a History API fallback.
Luckily the Web Dev Server  allows us to do this easily. 
Open up the web-dev-server.config.mjs  -file, and add the following line to your config: 
appIndex :  'index.html',

s0.title: Getting started: Using a starter
s0.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
s0.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

s1.title: Getting started: Using a starter
s1.headline: Initial setup
s1.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

s2.title: Getting started: Using a starter
s2.headline: Installing the router
s2.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

so.title: Simplr Router
so.headline: Why Simplr RouterQuick and simple
so.body: Simple to get up and running. Basic setup in just a few lines of code.

sp.title: Simplr Router
sp.headline: Small
sp.body: No dependencies and a small codebase means less breaking parts. 0 dependencies means that what you see is what you get.

sq.title: Simplr Router
sq.headline: Easy to transition into
sq.body: Works by utilizing the native API's used for navigation and therefore doesn't require any extra steps compared to your every day MPA.

sr.title: Simplr Router
sr.headline: Web Component focused
sr.body: Built with web components, for web components. Simplr Router was designed from the get go to be used in web component applications.

ss.title: Simplr Router
ss.headline: Customizable
ss.body: Even though there's no configuration necessary to get started, the router ships with a lot of customizability to fit your needs.

st.title: Simplr Router
st.headline: Performant
st.body: Allowing for lazy loading and creating dynamic routes, Simplr Router is a great library for projects of all sizes.

wi.title: Simplr Router

wi.body: Simple to get up and running. Basic setup in just a few lines of code.

wj.title: Simplr Router
wj.headline: Small
wj.body: No dependencies and a small codebase means less breaking parts. 0 dependencies means that what you see is what you get.

wk.title: Simplr Router
wk.headline: Easy to transition into
wk.body: Works by utilizing the native API's used for navigation and therefore doesn't require any extra steps compared to your every day MPA.

wl.title: Simplr Router
wl.headline: Web Component focused
wl.body: Built with web components, for web components. Simplr Router was designed from the get go to be used in web component applications.

wm.title: Simplr Router
wm.headline: Customizable
wm.body: Even though there's no configuration necessary to get started, the router ships with a lot of customizability to fit your needs.

wn.title: Simplr Router
wn.headline: Performant
wn.body: Allowing for lazy loading and creating dynamic routes, Simplr Router is a great library for projects of all sizes.

wv.title: Getting started: Using a starter
wv.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
wv.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

ww.title: Getting started: Using a starter
ww.headline: Initial setup
ww.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

wx.title: Getting started: Using a starter
wx.headline: Installing the router
wx.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

11r.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

11s.title: Getting started: Using a starter
11s.headline: Initial setup
11s.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

11t.title: Getting started: Using a starter
11t.headline: Installing the router
11t.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

17t.title: Getting started: Using a starter
17t.headline: Installing the router
17t.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

18j.headline: Performant

1he.title: Simplr Router
1he.headline: Why Simplr RouterQuick and simple
1he.body: Simple to get up and running. Basic setup in just a few lines of code.

1hf.title: Simplr Router
1hf.headline: Small
1hf.body: No dependencies and a small codebase means less breaking parts. 0 dependencies means that what you see is what you get.

1hg.title: Simplr Router
1hg.headline: Easy to transition into
1hg.body: Works by utilizing the native API's used for navigation and therefore doesn't require any extra steps compared to your every day MPA.

1hh.title: Simplr Router
1hh.headline: Web Component focused
1hh.body: Built with web components, for web components. Simplr Router was designed from the get go to be used in web component applications.

1hi.title: Simplr Router
1hi.headline: Customizable
1hi.body: Even though there's no configuration necessary to get started, the router ships with a lot of customizability to fit your needs.

1hj.title: Simplr Router
1hj.headline: Performant
1hj.body: Allowing for lazy loading and creating dynamic routes, Simplr Router is a great library for projects of all sizes.

1hs.title: Getting started: Using a starter
1hs.headline: Getting started: Using a starter
1hs.body:
Simplr Router was built to work with Web Component environments and therefore the Open-WC starter 
is a perfect base for using this router.

1ht.title: Getting started: Using a starter
1ht.headline: Initial setup
1ht.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

1hu.title: Getting started: Using a starter
1hu.headline: Installing the router
1hu.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.

allowing for on-demand loading of content as it's needed, reducing initial load on your app.

of time in your page's initial load times.

1ls.title: Getting started: Using a starter
1ls.headline: Initial setup
1ls.body:
Start by initializing your project with the Open-WC starter 
npm  init @open-wc
  
This will prompt you to generate a starter application for your web component project. You should choose to create
an application, and add whatever optional tooling you need. 
The setup we're using in this tutorial is as follows: 
✔ What would you like to do today? › Scaffold a new project
✔ What would you like to scaffold? › Application
✔ What would you like to add? ›
✔ Would you like to use typescript? › No
✔ What is the tag name of your application/web component? … simplr-router-demo

1lt.title: Getting started: Using a starter
1lt.headline: Installing the router
1lt.body:
npm  install  @simplr-wc/router
  
This command will install the Simplr Router to your project and will be ready to use as soon as it's finished installing.
